it.unipr.ce.dsg.deus.core
Class Event

java.lang.Object
  it.unipr.ce.dsg.deus.core.SimulationObject
      it.unipr.ce.dsg.deus.core.Event
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<Event>
Direct Known Subclasses:
DeathEvent, LogNodeDegreeEvent, LogPopulationSizeEvent, NodeEvent
public abstract class Event
extends SimulationObject
implements java.lang.Comparable<Event>, java.lang.Cloneable

The Event class represents the simulation object being scheduled by the Engine.

Each event is identified by the configuration id, a set of properties, a flag indicating if the event should be executed only once, a set of referenced events, a parent process, the triggering time and a listener to handle the execution of referenced events.

Each implementing class should provide the code for cloning the event ensuring that its internal state is consistent. In order to keep the simulation memory area as small as possible, each event is created by cloning the original event obtained from the simulation configuration parser. Be sure to re-initialize the event members that you do not want to be cloned.

Author:
Matteo Agosti (agosti@ce.unipr.it), Michele Amoretti (michele.amoretti@unipr.it)

Constructor Detail

Event

public Event(java.lang.String id,
             java.util.Properties params,
             Process parentProcess)
      throws InvalidParamsException
Class constructor that builds the event with its minimal set of properties. Each implementing class should call the super constructor and immediately after invoke the initialize method to check that the event parameters are correct.

Parameters:
id - the identifier of the event as specified in the configuration file.
params - the properties that will be handled by the event.
parentProcess - the parent process of the event.
Throws:
InvalidParamsException - if the given parameter are wrong.

initialize

public abstract void initialize()
                         throws InvalidParamsException
Provides the initialization of the event according to the given parameters. This method should also perform a check on the parameters values.

Throws:
InvalidParamsException - if the parameters passed to the event are wrong.

run

public abstract void run()
                  throws RunException
Implementing class should provide in this method the code used for the event execution.

Throws:
RunException - if the event execution fails.

scheduleReferencedEvents

public void scheduleReferencedEvents()
Add to the simulation event queue all the referenced events of the current event, by scheduling them according to their parent process strategy. Each time an event is scheduled, the scheduling listener is invoked so that the event itself is notified of that operation.

compareTo

public int compareTo(Event e)
Standard implementation of the compareTo method that uses the triggering time as sorting criteria.

Specified by:
compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Event>

setSchedulerListener

public void setSchedulerListener(SchedulerListener l)
Sets the scheduler listener for the event's referenced events.

Parameters:
l - the scheduler listener.

setOneShot

public void setOneShot(boolean isOneShot)
Sets if the event is one shot. If true the event will be executed only once, if false the event will be scheduled immediately after its execution using a triggering time determined by its parent process strategy.

Parameters:
isOneShot - whether the node is one shot.

isOneShot

public boolean isOneShot()
Returns true if the node is one shot (will be scheduled only once), false otherwise.

Returns:
true if the node is one shot (will be scheduled only once), false otherwise.
